instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts down at about 20% of progress bar. Was working fine.
threads.message: Any idea where to start with this? It happens only when booting. So it's loading something and shutting down at that same point each time. Was working for about 2 months. Onboard Apple diagnostic says there's nothing wrong. Not sure where to go with this. It was a spill. Unfortunately, no pictures and no signs of where the damage is.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts down at about 20% of progress bar. Was working fine.
threads.message: Usually corrosion around CPU Vcore regulators. <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts down at about 20% of progress bar. Was working fine.
threads.message: You nailed this one. <CAPACITOR>C7319</CAPACITOR> was beat up and barely making a connection. It worked for a while then failed. I replaced it along with a couple other ugly capacitors around it and it's back up and running. Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts down at about 20% of progress bar. Was working fine.
threads.message: The board would work fine without <CAPACITOR>C7319</CAPACITOR>, just a bypass cap among many others. So the board working again is something else...

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts down at about 20% of progress bar. Was working fine.
threads.message: Ok, good to know. Maybe one of the capacitors around it then. Not sure. It was solidly not working until I replaced those 4 capacitors and now it is solidly working. Hopefully it holds up.
